The "caste system" was the principal feature of Chinese society throughout the Han Dynasty . It divided the people into "lily-white" nobility and "jade green" people. (The jade-green people were peasants, mostly of the lowest level of society, who were enslaved by the ruling aristocrats of the aristocracy). The elite of this system were the lily-white nobility, the nobility of the "pure" realm of the royal family. The jade-green people were the lower class of the system. The system was deeply stratified, and it was not uncommon for ordinary citizens to be in many different classes, or even to be so poor that they could not afford to pay taxes, which made them dependent on the lily-white nobility .
